prior_knowledge_digest: Students are expected to have a basic understanding of language learning concepts, such as vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation. They should be familiar with the idea of conjugating verbs and the importance of memorization in language acquisition. Previous exposure to any Romance language can be beneficial, but is not required.
yesterday_recap: N/A - This is the first day of the course.
misconception_watchlist: Latin is a spoken language like modern languages.
Latin pronunciation is the same as English.

primary: Introduce the Latin alphabet and pronunciation.
Familiarize students with basic Latin greetings and phrases.
Understand the significance of Latin in historical and modern contexts.

materials: Handout with basic greetings and phrases

lesson_flow.description: Welcome students and introduce the course.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and ask any initial questions.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Set a positive and welcoming tone.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the Latin alphabet and pronunciation.
lesson_flow.student_action: Repeat after the teacher and practice pronunciation.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use audio clips to demonstrate correct pronunciation.

lesson_flow.description: Practice basic Latin greetings and phrases.
lesson_flow.student_action: Pair up and practice greetings with a partner.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Circulate to provide feedback and encouragement.

lesson_flow.description: Discuss the faith phrase 'In principio erat Verbum' and its significance.
lesson_flow.student_action: Reflect on the phrase and its meaning.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Connect the phrase to the importance of language in faith.

lesson_flow.description: Review key points and preview the next lesson.
lesson_flow.student_action: Ask questions and note down homework.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage students to review the alphabet and greetings at home.

behavior.loop_behavior: Reiterate key points if students seem confused.
